thread.title: Stuck in the middle
thread.title_full: Stuck in the middle | The Sunday Times

author: Martin Hemming
title: Stuck in the middle
text:
Nobody has ever asked for the middle seat on a plane. The question does not go: “Window or aisle or middle, sir?” The middle seat is air travel’s short straw. It has no redeeming features. Until now. The budget American airline Frontier has announced that it is making its middle seats 19in wide — a whopping whole inch wider than its window and aisle seats. It’s long overdue recognition that middle-seat flyers deserve much, much better.
Yes, in a window seat, you have to do the “I’m frightfully sorry, but I need to go to the loo, so please wake up immediately” poke, but nobody’s doing it back to you; plus, you get a window to look out of and a wall to try to sleep against. The aisle seat gives you ready loo and gin-and-tonic access, as well as splaying room, with only a minor risk of the cabin crew
